page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS OF GT AYTON
page.content:
On Guisborough Road, alongside the cemetary, is Yatton House, a day centre to provide work for mentally handicapped young adults. It is funded partly by the Social Services and partly by charity.
Holly Garth and Beech Close, off the High Street, provides sheltered accommodation for old people. They comprise houses to allow independent living but linked by phone to a full time nurse-warden. Costs are met by the Social Services. Village schoolchildren visit by arrangement.
Ayton has links with a village called Sambel Kunda in the Gambia. Money for wells, fertilisers and crops has been sent to this Third World country.
